column1: To think very carefully about something that you are doing
At or towards the back of a thing or person
A common farm bird that is kept for its meat and eggs
A small green animal that lives near water and has long legs for jumping
A pain in your head
A room or building containing books that can be looked at or borrowed
A place where hot water comes up naturally from the ground
The part of a person’s or animal’s face used for smelling or breathing
Someone whose job is to look after people who are ill or injured usually in a hospital
Having very little money and not many possessions
A small animal with long ears and soft fur that lives in a hole in the ground
A natural and continuous flow of water in a long line across a country into the sea
Nervous and embarrassed about meeting and speaking to other people
A large ball of burning gas in space that can be seen at night as a point of light in the sky
A building or place with a stage where plays and shows are performed
An object that you use to protect yourself against rain or hot sun
The brother of your mother or father
A railway system that runs under the ground below a big city
One of the hard white objects in your mouth that you use to bite and eat food
A written or printed message that is usually put in an envelope and sent by mail
